Items

Victorian Era Literature (1832-1901)

Abraham, Abraham. A Catechism of Religious and Moral Instruction for Children of the Hebrew Faith. Liverpool, 1840.

---. Moral and Religious Tales for the Young of the Hebrew Faith, Adapted from the French of “Les Matinées du Samedi” of G. Ben Levi. Whittaker, 1846.

Abraham, Philip. The Autobiography of a Jewish Gentleman. London, 1860.

---. Autumn Gatherings, Being a Collection of Prose and Poetry. J. Wertheimer, 1866.

---. Curiosities of Judaism: Facts, Opinions, Anecdotes, and Remarks Relative to the Hebrew Nation. Wertheimer, Lea and Co., 1879.

Abrahams (Sussman), Abraham. Millel Avraham. London, 1882.

---. Zekhor le-Avraham. London, 1860.

Abrahams, Louis Barnett, editor. The Jewish Record. 1868–c.1871.

---. A Manual of Scripture History for use in Jewish Schools and Families. 2nd ed., Trubner, 1882.

---. Murby’s Chronological History of England. Thomas Murby, 1870.

Adler, Marcus Nathan. The Itinerary of Benjamin of Tudela: Critical Text, Translation and Commentary. Oxford University Press, 1907.

Adler, Nathan Marcus. The Bonds of Brotherhood; A Sermon, Delivered in the Synagogue Sha’ar Hashamayim of the Spanish and Portuguese Congregation in London. J. Wertheimer, 1849.

---. How Can the Blessings of the House of God be Attained? A Sermon Delivered on the Occasion of the Consecration of the Synagogue at Canterbury. Sherwood, Gilbert, and Piper, 1848.

---. The Jewish Faith; A Sermon Delivered in the Great Synagogue, Duke’s Place, Sabbath, 24 Shevat, 5608. J. Wertheimer, 1848.

---. The Morning and Evening Sacrifice; A Sermon Delivered in the Great Synagogue, Duke’s Place, on January 28, 5625. Wertheimer, 1865.

---. Netinah la-Ger (A Gift to the Proselyte). 1872. Romm, 1874.

The Second Days of the Festivals; A Sermon at the New Synagogue, Great St. Helen’s, on the Second Day of Passover, 5628. Trübner, 1868.

Sermon Delivered in the Great Synagogue, Duke’s Place, Wednesday, the 24th March, A.M., 5607. Sherwood, Gilbert, and Piper, 1847.

Sermon Delivered at the Great Synagogue, on the Occasion of His Installation into Office as Chief Rabbi Great Britain. Translated by Barnard Van Oven, Longman, Brown, Green and Longmans, 1845.

Solomon’s Judgment: A Picture of Israel; A Sermon Delivered at the Great Synagogue, on Shabbat Chanukah, 31st December, 5614. Wertheimer, 1854.

Aguilar, Grace. See Bibliography of Grace Aguilar.

Alexander, Samuel. Moral Order and Progress: An Analysis of Ethical Conceptions. Trubner, 1889.

Amschejewitz, Asher. Sefer Asher Ha-Midot. 1879.

---. Shem Olam. 1864.

Angel, Moses, editor. The Jewish Chronicle, 1841–1842.

Angel, Moses. The Law of Sinai and its Appointed Times. William Tegg, 1858.

Artom, Benjamin. Sermons Preached in Several Synagogues. Trubner, 1873.

Ascher, Benjamin, trans. The Book of Life (Sefer Hachayim) by Simon Frankfor. Meldola, Cahn, & Co., 1847.

---, trans. Mivhar ha-Peninim (A Choice of Pearls) by Solomon ben Gabirol, 1859.

Asher, Asher. “Jewish Rite of Circumcision,” 1873.

Ballin, Ada Sarah. From Cradle to School: A Book for Mothers. Constable, 1902.

Ballin, Ada Sarah, and F. L. Ballin. A Hebrew Grammar with Exercises Selected from the Bible. C. Kegan Paul & Co., 1881.

Ballin, Ada Sarah, ed. Nursery Cookery. F. L. Ballin, 1900.

---. The Science of Dress in Theory and Practice. Sampson Low, Marston, Searle, & Rivington, 1885.

Behrend, Henry. “Essay on the Post-Biblical History of the Jews,” 1850.

---. “A Defense of the Mosaic Regulations.”

Belisario, Miriam Mendes. A Hebrew and English Vocabulary from a Selection of the Daily Prayers. 1848. P. Vallentine, 1878.

---. Sabbath Evenings at Home. 2 vols., S. Joel, 1856.

Bennett, Solomon Yom Tov. Critical Remarks on the Authorized Versions of the Old Testament. London, 1834.

---. A Theological and Critical Treatise on the Primogeniture and Integrity of the Holy Language. Richard Taylor, 1835.

Bresslau, Marcus, ed. The Hebrew Review. Vol. 1, nos. 1–48, 1860.

---. Kitzur Dikduk Lashon Ivri (A Compendious Hebrew Grammar). John Weale, 1855.

Browning, Robert. “Ben Karshook’s Wisdom.” The Keepsake, 1856, p. 16.

---. “Holy-Cross Day.” Men and Women. Vol. 2, Chapman and Hall, 1855, pp. 158–166.

---. “Jochanan Hakkadosh.” Jocoseria. Smith, Elder & Co., 1883, pp. 71–132.

---. “Rabbi Ben Ezra.” Dramatis Personae. Chapman & Hall, 1864, pp. 77–87.

---. “Saul.” Men and Women. Vol. 2, Chapman and Hall, 1855, pp. 111–146.

---. “Solomon and Balkis.” Jocoseria. Smith, Elder & Co., 1883, pp. 25–32.

Mocatta, Isaac Lindo. The Jewish Armoury. Brighton, 1877.

---. Moral Biblical Gleanings and Practical Teachings, Illustrated by Biographical Sketches Drawn from the Sacred Volume. Trübner & Co., 1872.

Newman, Selig. The Challenge Accepted: A Dialogue Between a Jew and a Christian. Isaacs & Solomons, 1850.

---. Emendations of the English Version of the Old Testament. B. Wertheim, 1839.

---. Sefer ha-Shorashim [Book of Roots], A Hebrew and English Lexicon. Longman, Reese, Orme, Brown, and Green, 1834.

---, Sefer Milim [Book of Words], An English and Hebrew Lexicon. Longman, Rees, Orme, Brown, and Green, 1832.

 

Victorian Jewish Writers Project

Welcome to the Victorian Jewish Writers Project, a digital collection focusing on Anglo-Jewish writing during the long nineteenth century. The site is a work-in-progress, so please contact katzir [at] vjwp [dot] org if you need one-on-one assistance.
